rules.description: The continuation rules for lines in the transit system.

method.description: Services continue from the shared terminus of multiple linear lines. Inbound services from 'Side A' form outbound services on 'Side B' and vice-versa.

from.description: The stop where services are joined from being the original service to the continuation.

sideA.description: List of lines on which inbound services from 'Side B' form an outbound service.

sideB.description: List of lines on which inbound services from 'Side A' form an outbound service.

layoverMins.description: Required time range (in minutes) between ending one service and beginning the next. E.g. '3' or '2..6'.

method.description: Services continue from the terminus inside the loop formed by the hook. Inbound 'hooked' services form direct outbound services and vice-versa.

lines.description: The lines to consider when selecting the appropriate next service.

layoverMins.description: Required time range (in minutes) between ending one service and beginning the next. E.g. '3' or '2..6'.
